Text: Faculty Evaluations Cc you will be planning your courses for the spring semester shortly and may have an interest in faculty evaluations from prior semesters If youve tried to check them out you may have noticed that link from the Faculty Web pages to the evals is missing In fact the Faculty Web site is under construction and the link should be up soon In the meantime I thought you would like the URL to go to the evals directly FacultyEvals If you have concerns about a bad evaluation please feel free to ask Diane or me for some background Dont assume that if a faculty member got a bad eval that heshe addressed the issues Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax

RE Correction RE Faculty EvaluationsJeff Did you get our registration packet If not stop by and pick one up because you need it Make sure you get the one for new students The deadline for signing up for core courses is November Electives and units November Sign up for unit courses in the office Hope classes and life in general are going well Shawn On Wednesday November AM Jeff Dasovich SMTP wrote ok dont shoot me but whats the deadline for scheduling for classes signed clueless

Registration Results Round Onedisregard if you are not taking electives in the spring semester We have reviewed TeleBEARS enrollments from last weeks deadline and corrected your schedule in TeleBEARS to reflect the courses that you are now registered for Please check TeleBEARS to confirm your schedule and review wait lists below So whats next CHECK InfoBEARS to see what you got into You can call or go to bearlinkberkeleyedu and use your SID and PIN to review your schedule You can call any time of day Use TeleBEARS for changes DROP the extra backups that you dont need by November Friday Use TeleBEARS or call the Drop Hotline with the course control numbers of the courses you want to drop at Both options open am or pm to midnight Monday through Friday ADD extra classes if you like by November Friday You must use TeleBEARS during open hours to add a class Call or go to bearlinkberkeleyedu am or pm to midnight Monday through Friday We will confirm your schedule by the middle of next week Course materials will be ordered for you based on your November enrollment We have not completed registration for oneunit classes I will be finalizing those enrollments this week If you are depending on those units be sure to sign up for a backup just in case you dont get in to all of the oneunit courses you requested As always please call or email us if you have questions Oversubscribed Class Wait Lists As of Friday November Below are the wait lists for classes that were oversubscribed To see if you got into the class check InfoBEARS Note you are not listed below if you were not registered by the November deadline listed in the registration materials Remember the TeleBEARS wait list number is incorrect Positions on the wait lists are determined by seniorityFwhich we cannot adjust in TeleBEARS We are in the process of adding some of you to wait lists in TeleBEARS If you are not listed there but are listed below dont worry The lists below are accurate E Financial Info ALEXANDER These wait list numbers OVERRIDE the wait list numbers given out by TeleBEARS

Financial Timesall I hope the Financial Times has been working with you to get the paper delivered to you For those of you who are still having trouble I have arranged for papers a day to come to the Evening MBA Program office as a workaround for the rest of the term We will keep a few days worth as space allows Please follow a couple of ground rules so that this will work for everyone Please be considerate and only take a paper if you are sure that you did not receive one at home Do not take one just because you left yours at home If you want to review the paper at Haas before class please use the Web or the Long Library copies In the event of a delivery problem please call or email the Financial Times see below unless they have just told you that they cannot get the paper to you In this case ask FT to mail the paper to you instead of reluctantly trying to get a carrier to go to your house Be patient if you come to the office and we have run out of papers We will try to increase the number of backups if necessary When you come to the office to pick up a paper we will have a list for you to record the missed delivery Please help us to track the problems We received our first papers today and have last Fridays as well For contacting the Financial Times in the event of problems or address changes please ask for Gayle at FT Education or I hope this is helpful to those of you who have had severe problems with the paper Have a great SHORT week and a happy Thanksgiving Shawn Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax

Spring Schedulesare now finished with the Spring schedules If you call InfoBEARS at you should be able to access your spring schedule Alternatively you can go to InfoBEARS via bearlinkberkeleyedu If you have problems let me know DISREGARD waitlist numbers in InfoBEARS I will send waitlist numbers tomorrow that are correct If you wish to make further modifications to your schedule you may do so beginning January Shawn Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax

ETelecom EBusiness Cc the syllabus for E Professor Hartman will let us know if there is material to prepare for next week and we will let you know I thought it would be helpful for some of you that are interested in the content to see the syllabus in the meantime Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax ejandoc

ETelecom EBusinessthe attached syllabus expanded and was gibberish for many of you If you dont receive it this time you can stop by the office and pick up a copy I will also forward a pdf file with the reading for next week Resend Attached is the syllabus for E Professor Hartman will let us know if there is material to prepare for next week and we will let you know I thought it would be helpful for some of you that are interested in the content to see the syllabus in the meantime Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax ejandoc
E Assignmentread chapter two attached for next week We will order the text and get it here as quickly as possible chaphartpdf

Cohorts for Spring Everyone Happy Friday We have done the cohort assignments for spring And I think we accommodated all of your requests We will do up something pretty and put them in your mailboxes next week but I know you are all anxious to get your assignments so I am attaching a list with your cohort assignment Please let me know if this is different that your request If you did not make a request I cannot guarantee that we can make changes at this point Good luck studying for your finals Shawn Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax s cohortsxls

homework one more timenoticed that many of you were not signed up on this alias so I apologize to those of you who are receiving this twice Shawn Message below from Professor Levine regarding EB Dear Macro class This message concerns the first macroeconomics class which will be held next week October in C Please read in the textbook The Science of Macroeconomics and The Data of Macroeconomics Mankiw Chapters and You should start receiving the Financial Times a few days before class begins If you do not receive your first copy before class begins please contact Shawn Allison aas Homework zero Please do before first class but do not hand in List three ways in which GDP over or understates a nations typical standard of living List reasons why the CPI might over or understate the true inflation rate What are reasons why it matters if the CPI is accurate Please look in the Financial Times and find a story that fits your name A If your first name begins with AD find a story concerning why living standards and output per capita differ so much between one or more richer and poorer countries B If your first name begins with EK find a story concerning persistently high or low unemployment and inflation C If your first name begins with LO find a story concerning interest rates and central bank policies D If your first name begins with PS find a story concerning exchange rates and one or more of trade deficits the current account or capital mobility E If your first name begins with TZ find a story concerning government macroeconomic policy andor corruption I look forward to meeting you all in a few days Good luck on your finals this week Pleas remind classmates to sign onto the email alias eb or eb they are identical as only people total have signed up Till soon David David I Levine Associate professor Haas School of Business ph University of California fax Berkeley CA email wwwlevine Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax
E Assignmentread chapter two attached for next week We will order the text and get it here as quickly as possible chaphartpdf

Mankiw Chapters and You should start receiving the Financial Times a few days before class begins If you do not receive your first copy before class begins please contact Shawn Allison aas Homework zero Please do before first class but do not hand in List three ways in which GDP over or understates a nations typical standard of living List reasons why the CPI might over or understate the true inflation rate What are reasons why it matters if the CPI is accurate Please look in the Financial Times and find a story that fits your name A If your first name begins with AD find a story concerning why living standards and output per capita differ so much between one or more richer and poorer countries B If your first name begins with EK find a story concerning persistently high or low unemployment and inflation C If your first name begins with LO find a story concerning interest rates and central bank policies D If your first name begins with PS find a story concerning exchange rates and one or more of trade deficits the current account or capital mobility E If your first name begins with TZ find a story concerning government macroeconomic policy andor corruption I look forward to meeting you all in a few days Good luck on your finals this week Pleas remind classmates to sign onto the email alias eb or eb they are identical as only people total have signed up Till soon David David I Levine Associate professor Haas School of Business ph University of California fax Berkeley CA email wwwlevine Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax

Spring Schedulesare now finished with the Spring schedules If you call InfoBEARS at you should be able to access your spring schedule Alternatively you can go to InfoBEARS via bearlinkberkeleyedu If you have problems let me know DISREGARD waitlist numbers in InfoBEARS I will send waitlist numbers tomorrow that are correct If you wish to make further modifications to your schedule you may do so beginning January Shawn Shawn Allison Associate Director Evening MBA Program Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Tel Fax
